I updated from SeaMonkey 2.2 to SeaMonkey 2.3 less than an hour ago.  

On the menu bar, I selected [Edit > Preferences].  On the Preferences window, I selected [Advanced > Software Installation].  On the Software Installation pane, I selected the Show Update History button.  The Update History window indicated "No updates installed yet".  

The Update History window might be correct for extensions installed into the current SeaMonkey 2.3.  All of my extensions were installed under SeaMonkey 2.2.  However, the Show Update History button appears within the box titled "SeaMonkey" and not in the box titled "Add-ons".
comments.author: david@rossde.com

comments.raw_text:
WFM.

That looks to be the case.

Help | Check for Updates, downloads the update file (the .mar), updating from 2.2 to 2.3.

In the process, the file updates.xml is created (if it did not exist), or I suppose updated (appended?) if it did.  And it is from there that the 'Show Update History' gets its data.

So no .mar update, no updates.xml, nothing to display.

A full installer would bypass that procedure, so again no updates.xml, nothing to display.

comments.text: It is not necessary to be automatic - the update history is just populated by updates made through the automated update mechanism (Help -> Check for Updates...), which could be triggered manually, also.  Installing using a full installer essentially clears this update history.  So I guess this report is more likely invalid.

comments.raw_text:
Additionally the update history is tricky by another reason: When run from a no-admin account under Windows the internal updates fail silently. Internal updates only work when Seamonkey is "Run as Admin". The update history is correct under this account. Under the no-admin account no updates are shown, even not the successful updates from the admin account.

To OPs bug:
Replace "The following updates have been installed:" with "Updates made to this installation:" above the list of the updates.

And replace "No updates installed yet" with "No software updates yet".
